questions.question: What is the term for the rate of change of velocity with respect to time?
What is the product of an object's mass and its velocity called?
What is the principle stating that the pressure in a fluid decreases as the fluid's speed increases?
What is the term for the energy an object possesses due to its position or condition?
What is the term for the apparent outward force that draws a rotating body away from the center of rotation?
Which of the following is a measure of an object's resistance to rotational acceleration?
What is the term for the motion of an object in two dimensions under the influence of gravity?
What is the name of the principle that states that the total mechanical energy of an isolated system remains constant?
What is the term for the phenomenon in which the amplitude of oscillation increases when a periodic force is applied at the natural frequency of the system?
Which of the following best describes the principle of conservation of angular momentum?
options: The total angular momentum of a closed system remains constant
The angular momentum of an object changes only when a net external torque is applied
Angular momentum is always conserved in the absence of external forces
